intro: Calyptrostegia glauca, commonly known as the blue star cactus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its blue-gray foliage and vibrant yellow or white flowers make it an attractive ornamental plant. Calyptrostegia glauca is often cultivated for its drought tolerance and unique appearance in gardens.
